p: Caflanone is a small phytoantiviral flavonoid molecule with selective activity against the human coronavirus hCov-OC43 (COVID-19) disease belonging to clade b of the genus Betacoronavirus same as SARS-COV-2 [ 34]. In preclinical studies, Caflanone inhibited the hCov-OC43 human Coronavirus with an EC50 of 0.42 ÂµM [ 31]. In silico studies show that the Caflanone molecule carries out its prophylactic mechanism of action by inhibiting the Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor found in the lung and respiratory tract, used by the virus to cause an infection [ 31]. Caflanone was also shown to have strong binding affinity to two of the proteases (PLpro and 3CLpro) are vital to the replication of SARS-COV-2 in humans, which would inhibit viral entry to and/or replication within human cells [ 31].
